Hi Support, 

Customer has requested us to check PING and TELNET tests from EPP server to their side. 
Note that the server is hosted by Netwrix (SaaS)

Link: awkb43e.hosted.endpointprotector.com

-	Port 25

Subject: Netwrix Support Ticket #439297 - [Averis] Unable to integrate SMTP server

TextBody:
Hello Team,

To respond to your inquiry related to the port, by default, Amazon Elastic Cloud Compute (Amazon EC2) throttles instances on the Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP) port 25 to prevent spam from being sent out. AWS blocks outbound traffic on port 25 for all EC2 instances and Lambda functions on elastic network interfaces.

Looking forward to your response.

Best Regards,
Marian Ilies | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.netwrix.com

TextBody:
ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000N5uIs:ref

Hi Marian, 

I have received a query from customer. They are asking if Netwrix can enable port 25 for them, is it possible?

I have replied then that, "I will confirm and netwrix might need a written consent from you to do this, due to possible security threats". 

Kindly advise on this. 

Thanks, 
Milan Singh
Subject: Netwrix Support Ticket #439297 - [Averis] Unable to integrate SMTP server

TextBody:
Hello,

Thank you for getting back to us.

As we have mentioned before, port 25 is not blocked by Netwrix but by AWS directly.

Amazon Web Services (AWS) often restricts traffic over port 25 to prevent misuse and to ensure security compliance, therefore it is out of our reach in this case.

Let me know if you have further inquiries.

Best Regards,
Marian Ilies | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.netwrix.com

ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000N5uIs:ref

Hi Support, 

It is understood that port 25 can pose certain security concerns, and the consideration of those risks is appreciated. 

However, port 25 is primarily used for customer's SMTP traffic. Could Netwrix request AWS to allow port 25 for specifically for their use?

Kindly advise.

Thanks, 
Milan Singh
Subject: Netwrix Support Ticket #439297 - [Averis] Unable to integrate SMTP server

TextBody:
Hello,

Thanks for getting back to us.

We will have to forward this to our internal team to proceed further but keep in mind that we can only have the port 25 allowed for outgoing only.

Please let me know the IP address or DNS server you need to forward the port to.

Looking forward to your response.

Best Regards,
Marian Ilies | Technical Support Engineer

DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption

ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000N5uIs:ref

Hi Andre,
Good day to you!

Hope this email finds you well.
I would like to request for update on this.

Thanks,
Milan Singh
Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #439297 - [Averis] Unable to integrate SMTP server    [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0N5uIs:ref ]

TextBody:
Hello Milan

Can we ask you to please try to do the following steps:

1. Verify the SMTP Configuration, make sure the SMTP configuration is correct and functional.

I recommend deleting the current SMTP settings (simply clear the fields and save the configuration). Then, go back to System Configuration → System Settings, re-enter the SMTP details, and check the option "Send email to my account." (A printscreen with the configuration will be helpful)

This option triggers a test email. (Ask the customer to check if received the email)
- If the customer receives the test email, it means the SMTP configuration is working correctly. 
- If the customer does not receive the test email, the configuration is still incorrect. In that case, they will not receive any email alerts.
Currently, this is the reason why a "Failed" status appears in the Alert History page.

2. Please ask the customer also to check the message queues from Symantec Messaging Gateway to see if the email is not blocked there.

After completing the above steps, please let me know and I will collect the latest mail logs from our end.



Kind regards
__________________
André Le Roux | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com
